metadata.Title: CVE-2019-20445 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
HttpObjectDecoder.java in Netty before 4.1.44 allows a Content-Lengthheader to be accompanied by a second Content-Length header, or by aTransfer-Encoding header.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-20445` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnetty-java - 1:4.1.45-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: netty package in esm-apps/jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:4.1.45-1').
